intro: Dortmanna pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered Dortmanna, is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Dortmanna pauciflora is adapted to cold climates and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils.
